snippet: The government demanded that foreign governments stop releasing data on China’s air quality, as is regularly done by a sensor at the American Embassy in Beijing.
abstract: China demands that foreign governments stop releasing data on its air quality; statement is aimed at the United States, which monitors air pollution in Beijing via a sensor at its embassy, posting the results hourly on Twitter; data has given rise to mounting health concerns among Chinese concerning air pollution.
lead_paragraph: The government demanded that foreign governments stop releasing data on China’s air quality, as is regularly done by a sensor at the American Embassy in Beijing.

headline.seo: China Asks Foreign Governments to Stop Reporting on Its Air Quality
headline.main: China Asks Other Nations Not to Release Its Air Data
headline.print_headline: China Asks Other Nations Not to Release Its Air Data
